name: Ogmia

attributes.attribute: Assumed to be a British version of the continental Celtic god of eloquence Ogmios and the Irish god Ogma
Depicted by Romano-Celtic artists as a curly-haired youth with rays erupting from his head
Nothing is known of his myth or cult

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: A curly-haired youth with rays erupting from his head, Ogmia was a British god, thought to be the British counterpart of Ogmios, the Celtic god of eloquence on the continent, and Ogma, the Irish god. Although depicted by Romano-Celtic artists, there is currently no information available regarding the myth or cult of Ogmia.
